overview: This module provides a comprehensive introduction to JavaScript arrays, a fundamental list datatype in programming. Designed for beginners with little to no prior coding experience, the module covers array creation, manipulation, and basic operations. It concludes with a practical exercise where learners will apply their knowledge to create, modify, and iterate through an array of strings.
learnerPersona: Adult learners and aspiring professionals with little to no prior coding experience. Basic computer literacy is assumed.
prerequisites: Familiarity with basic JavaScript concepts (variables, data types)

microlessons.title: Introduction to JavaScript Arrays
microlessons.learningObjective: Define JavaScript arrays and explain how they organize data.
outline: Purpose and benefits of using arrays
How arrays organize and store data

microlessons.title: Array Components and Structure
microlessons.learningObjective: Identify the components of an array, including its elements and index positions.

microlessons.title: Creating Arrays with Literal Notation
microlessons.learningObjective: Create arrays using JavaScript literal notation.
outline: Creating arrays with different data types

microlessons.title: Accessing and Modifying Array Elements
microlessons.learningObjective: Access and modify elements within an array using square brackets.
outline: Using square bracket notation to access elements

microlessons.title: Basic Array Methods
microlessons.learningObjective: Use basic array methods, such as push() and pop(), to manage array data.
outline: Using push() to add elements to the end of an array
Using pop() to remove elements from the end of an array
Other useful array methods (e.g., unshift(), shift())
